content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a possible implementation of this problem:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks in the markdown document
    regex = r"```julia\n(.*?)```"s
    code_blocks = collect(eachmatch(regex, md))

    if isempty(code_blocks)
        return ""
    end

    # Join all code blocks together with a newline
    joined_code = join([m.captures[1] for m in code_blocks], "\n")

    return joined_code
end
```
This function uses a regular expression to match the Julia language code blocks in the markdown document. The `collect(eachmatch(regex, md))` line collects all matches of the regular expression into an array. If no matches are found (i.e., there are no code blocks), it returns an empty string. Otherwise, it joins together all matched strings with a newline and returns this result.
